oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ökologische Milchziegenhaltung: Welche Leistungen sind möglich?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rahmann, Gerold
Hauschild, Birte
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sheep and goats
Animal husbandry
Feeding and growth
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: No data about lactation yield and milk performance for organic dairy goat keeping are available. Particularly information about the impact of grazing under different weather conditions and changes in herd composition are missing. The milk records of the experimental dairy goat herd at the research station in Northern Germany show the impact of management mistakes, wet weather conditions and changes in herd composition. When grazing starts in the spring and early summer, , all efforts must be made to ensure high milk yields. If the weather is too wet, goats should kept indoor at night. Last but not least, the changes in herd composition should be made carefully. Too many does in first lactation and does with more than four lactations reduce the milk yield. If these problems are solved, 700 to 900 kg of lactation milk yield is possible under organic standards.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Rahmann, Gerold and Hauschild, Birte (2009) Ökologische Milchziegenhaltung: Welche Leistungen sind möglich? Paper at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
